info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 6 at 2:53PM MDT by NWS Cheyenne WY
info.description:
At 252 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Federal to Happy Valley to near Willadsen Estates. Movement was east at 25 mph.
HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph and pea size hail.
SOURCE...Radar indicated.
IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor hail damage to vegetation is possible. Strong cross winds will be hazardous to light weight or high profile vehicles, including campers and tractor trailers.
Locations impacted include... Cheyenne, Happy Valley, Federal, Table Mountain Ranches, Rocking Star Ranch, Willadsen Estates, Silver Sage Estates, Fox Farm-College, Cheyenne Regional Airport, Winchester Hills, South Greeley Highway, Ranchettes, Warren AFB, Frontier Park, North Cheyenne, South Cheyenne, Bison Crossing, and Whitaker.
This includes the following highways... Interstate 25 in Wyoming between mile markers 1 and 29. Interstate 80 in Wyoming between mile markers 344 and 363.
info.instruction:
If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 800 PM MDT for southeastern Wyoming.

parameter.value: STRONG THUNDERSTORMS WILL IMPACT SOUTHWESTERN LARAMIE COUNTY THROUGH 330 PM MDT

area.areaDesc: South Laramie Range; South Laramie Range Foothills; Central Laramie County
